New Records: Josh Naylor notched his 100th RBI of 2024, giving Cleveland two 100-RBI teammates (joining José Ramírez) for the first time since Ramírez and Edwin Encarnacion in 2018.
Key Match Events: Gavin Williams tossed seven innings of one-hit ball to lead the Guardians to a 4-2 win over the Royals.
Lane Thomas slugged his first homer as a Guardian with a two-run blast in the fifth inning.
Josh Naylor hit a two-run shot in the sixth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Stephen Vogt praised Gavin Williams' performance, stating it was much needed for the team.
Gavin Williams emphasized the importance of the starting pitchers picking up the bullpen.
Royals second baseman Michael Massey acknowledged Williams' impressive fastball and breaking ball.
Stephen Vogt celebrated Josh Naylor's milestone of 100 RBIs, highlighting the importance of personal achievements.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland now leads Kansas City by 4 1/2 games in the AL Central.
The Guardians' rotation has a 4.58 ERA, which ranks 24th in the Majors.
